thread.title: Man tipped to be Donald Trump's NZ ambassador supports waterboarding, posed nude in magazine
thread.title_full: Man tipped to be Donald Trump's NZ ambassador supports waterboarding, posed nude in magazine

title: Man tipped to be Donald Trump's NZ ambassador supports waterboarding, posed nude in magazine
text:
Man tipped to be Donald Trump's NZ ambassador supports waterboarding, posed nude in magazine Last updated 14:03, February 18 2017 
The man being tipped to be the United States ambassador to New Zealand under Donald Trump supports waterboarding and once won the title of "America's Sexiest Man". 
Former US senator Scott Brown, 57, also doesn't appear to have any ties to New Zealand, but he did tell GQ Magazine in 2015 he "always wanted to go". 
Brown has led a varied life, and was a promising basketball star as a youngster before embarking on a military career where he rose to the rank of colonel. He also spent years as a male model in the 1980s. BRENDAN MCDERMID 
Scott Brown now works as a Fox News commentator. 
He is being considered by the Trump Administration for the ambassador role and has told associates he will get the nod for the position, The Boston Globe reported citing sources . 
READ MORE: 
An announcement was unlikely to be imminent and there was a possibility Brown could be tapped for another destination, Globe sources said. BRENDAN MCDERMID 
Former U.S. Senator from Massachusetts Scott Brown arrives to meet with Donald Trump at Trump Tower. 
Prime Minister Bill English would not be drawn on the matter, with his office saying that the appointment was a matter for the United States, not the New Zealand Government. 
Brown, a former Massachusetts senator alongside alongside former Secretary of State John Kerry from 2010-2013, has had a colourful history in and out of US politics. 
As a 22-year-old in 1982 he won Cosmopolitan magazine's "America's Sexiest Man" contest, posing nude in the centrefold . BRIAN SNYDER 
Scott Brown, left, with Donald Trump during the GOP presidential primaries. 
After taking up politics following a career in the army, he succeeded Ted Kennedy as senator in a surprise win in 2010 in Massachusetts. Ad Feedback 
He ran for full Senate in 2012, losing to the Democrats' Elizabeth Warren. 
As a Republican senator he endorsed the use of enhanced interrogation techniques - including the practice of simulated drowning known as waterboarding - in questioning terror suspects. 
Brown, who now works as a Fox News commentator, curried Trump's favour by endorsing him at a pivotal point of the 2016 GOP presidential primaries, just after Trump had lost Iowa to Ted Cruz and just before the New Hampshire primary. 
In June 2016, Brown was accused in a lawsuit of making sexually inappropriate comments and putting his hands on the lower waist of former Fox News host Andrea Tantaros. 
â€‹He denied the accusations. 
In 2011, Brown wrote an autobiography called Against All Odds where he spoke of being sexually abused as a 10 year old while on a summer camp, along with a childhood marred by violence and poverty. 
"Like a fractured bone, I have knit back stronger in the broken places," he wrote at the time. 
In the book he also details his life as a young basketball star, then law student, to parties at the legendary Studio 54 nightclub in New York. 
Brown mentioned his exploits as a shoplifter, with items taken ranging from a three-piece-suit, to steaks to music albums. 
The previous US ambassador to New Zealand, Mark Gilbert, left his Wellington post shortly after President Trump's inauguration in January. - Stuff
